comments:
Error come up in all attempts to run unit test:
1) In Run -> Run As -> JUnit Test
2) In separate JUnit runtime configuration.

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Error: parameter '-port' not specified 
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.
defaultInit(RemoteTestRunner.java:239) 
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.init(RemoteTestRunner
.java:177)
 at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.main(RemoteTestRunner
.java:166) 
Exception in thread "main"

need more information:
1) add the command line arguments when it fails
   (select the process in the debug view>properties)
2) which versions are you running

The problem was solved. This behaviour was caused by conflict between Eclipse 2.
1 and Ad-Muncher adv blocking software.

still curious: could you debug in this set-up? When debugging then a socket 
connection is established as well. If it works for debugging then I wonder why 
it doesn't work running JUnit tests

I don't know if this is related but I have a similar problem:
1) I create a new test target using "Run ... -> JUnit"
2) Then I modify the "Classpath" and include a folder of my project
   (resources needed by the unit tests like dtd-files)

JUnit fails to run and I don't even get feedback at all (well
on Linux I see the stack trace and on Windows XP the stack trace
is in the .metadata/.log file):

Bruno, this looks like another problem. I suspect you have a test case name 
with some some with space in it? There is a separate bug for this.

Yes, you are right. I have several test case names with spaces and commas
and they cause the problem. Thanks a lot!
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 26754 ***
